intro: Rourea boiviniana, commonly known as the Madagascar rourea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in shaded forest environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
